units.title: Add Trizol to organoid
units.text: Aspirate the medium from the insert with lung organoid and add 300 μl of Trizol to the insert using a P1000. Pipette up and down several times to break the Matrigel and collect the content of the insert. Transfer the organoid in trizol into a 1.5 ml tube and vortex until homogenized.
units.rationale: Collects and lyses the organoid for RNA extraction.

units.title: Centrifuge to remove Matrigel
units.text: Centrifuge the sample at 16,000g for 5 min at 4 °C to remove the residual Matrigel. Take the supernatant and mix with equal amount of 100% ethanol and vortex thoroughly.
units.rationale: Separates RNA‑containing supernatant from insoluble Matrigel.

units.title: DNase I digestion on column
units.text: In an RNase-free tube, add 5 μl DNase I (6 U/μl), 35 μl DNA Digestion Buffer and mix by gentle inversion. Add the mix directly to the column matrix. Incubate at room temperature (20–30 °C) for 15 min.
units.rationale: Removes contaminating DNA from the RNA preparation.

units.title: RNA PreWash step
units.text: Add 400 μl Direct-zol RNA PreWash to the column and centrifuge. Discard the ﬂow through and repeat this step.
units.rationale: Cleans the column before final RNA elution.

units.title: Fixation of tissue sections
units.text: Fix the samples in 4% paraformaldehyde for 20 min, wash two times for 5 min in 50 mM glycine to inactivate the PFA, followed by washing in PBS.
units.rationale: Preserves tissue morphology and quenches excess fixative.

units.title: Permeabilization and blocking
units.text: Permeabilize samples for 10 min in 0.2% PBST (PBS + 0.2% Triton X-100) and block by incubating in PBS containing 5% donkey serum for 1 h, then incubate overnight in primary antibody in 0.2% Triton X-100 and 2% donkey serum (for primary antibodies and suggested dilutions, see Table 1).
units.rationale: Allows antibody access while preventing non‑specific binding.

units.title: Release organoid from Matrigel
units.text: Add 1 ml of cell recovery reagent to the insert such that the embedded organoid with Matrigel falls into the 15 ml centrifuge tube.
units.rationale: Transfers organoid into a tube for downstream single‑cell processing.

units.title: Low‑speed centrifugation
units.rationale: Pellets the organoid without damaging fragile cells.

units.title: Accutase dissociation
units.text: Add 1 ml of Accutase to the organoid and incubate at 37 °C.
units.rationale: Enzymatically dissociates the organoid into single cells.

units.title: Prepare Matrigel‑coated dish
units.text: Prepare one Matrigel-coated dish as described in ‘Reagent setup.’
units.rationale: Provides a suitable surface for embryoid body formation.
